frameDefinitions: This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.
The Temperature in a certain environment, determined by Time and Place, is specified.
The Support, a phenomenon or fact,  lends support to a claim or proposed course of action, the Proposition, where the Domain_of_relevance may also be expressed.

The answer to one open question, the Outcome, is dictated (partially or completely) by the answer to another open question, the Determinant, i.e. if the answer to the Determinant is known, the answer to the Outcome can be predicted.

A Factor affects the outcome of an Undertaking, which  can be a goal-oriented activity or the maintenance of a desirable state, the work in a Field, or something portrayed as affecting an Interested_party.
A phenomenon, the Indicator, exists as an indication of another phenomenon, the Indicated.
frameExamples: We <t>searched</t> the yard  for my contact lens.
It's too <t>hot</t> to do anything today.
The latest poll results <t>show</t> that support of the president is at an all-time low.
Economic policy is partially a <t>function</t> of cultural values.
Temperature is the most <t>critical</t> factor in successful storage.
This is a <t>sign</t> of things to come.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This role can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:
An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>  that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is scrutinizing the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where  it is a certain <fen>Temperature</fen> .
The temperature feature of the weather.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Temperature</fen> of the environment.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Temperature</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which an ambient environment has a particular <fen>Temperature</fen>.
The meteorological conditions which determine the ambient temperature of a locale.
Support is a fact that lends epistemic support to a claim, or that provides a reason for a course of action. Typically it is expressed as an External Argument.
This is a belief, claim, or proposed course of action to which the Support lends validity. Normally it is expressed as a Finite Clause Complement:
An open question that is (to some degree) predictable from the Determinant.
An open question that determines the <fen>Outcome</fen>.
<fen>Factor</fen> is used for the concrete or abstract entity whose importance is assessed.
The <fen>Undertaking</fen> is a process or state or field of activity in which the <fen>Interested_party</fen> has a stake.
<fen>Interested_party</fen> identifies the people who are affected by a particular <fen>Factor</fen>.
A <fen>Factor</fen> may be generally important to the people or the activities in a field of endeavour.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Factor</fen> is important to the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Factor</fen> is important.
The phenomenon that signifies the <fen>Indicated</fen>.
The phenomenon that is signified by the <fen>Indicator</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Chapter four</fex> examined the case for free speech.
The temperature controller monitored the temperature <fex>with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.
The temperature  was <fex>85 F</fex> in the shade today
It's like <fex>totally</fex> chilly, dude, like, totally.
We get warmer <fex>weather</fex> this time of year.
<fex>The fact that you lied to me</fex> shows that I shouldn't trust you.
The fact that you lied to me shows <fex>that I shouldn't trust you</fex>.
Price, in such a case, depends <fex>only on the whim of the supplier</fex>.
<fex>Being sure they are buying fresh food</fex> is important to most people.
Temperature is the most critical factor <fex>in successful storage</fex>.
Being sure they are buying fresh food is important <fex>to most people</fex>.
A successful GATT round is important <fex>for the world economy</fex>.
He was unable to display any <fex>sign</fex> of pain.
We now exhibt the same symptoms <fex>of the same disease</fex>.
